questions.question_text:
Your database is on ARCHIVELOG mode and an incremental backup exists.
A media failure in the loss of a data file and an online redo log.
Examine these commands:
1. STARTUP NOMOUNT
2. STARTUP MOUNT
3. RESTORE DATABASE
4. RECOVER DATABASE
5. RECOVER DATABASE UNTIL CANCEL
6. ALTER DATABASE OPEN
7. ALTER DATABASE OPEN RESETLOGS
Which commands are required to recover your database?

comments.content:
After changing the parameters, only the current PDB is affected
Create pfile from spfile in PDB
The output spfile has only the changed parameters and no other parameters (19c)
Go back to the pfile produced in CDB$ROOT, there is no record of the changes that occurred in the PDB

I think A,B too.PDB_SPFILE$: initialization parameters for PDBs are stored in a system table called PDB_SPFILE$. ref:https://oracle-base.com/articles/12c/multitenant-configure-instance-parameters-of-cdb-and-pdb-12cr1#pdb_spfile

discussion.content:
I think A,B
Tested by own experiments
Also see the same conclusion on the following page
https://www.dbasolved.com/2014/02/spfile-for-a-cdb-vs-a-pdb/

Isn't it B, C?
Pleas help! I don't know correctly!

comments.content: yeah E is the correct answer

choices.D: The data dictionary in CDB$ROOT is updated.
choices.B: The STATISTICS_LEVEL parameter is set to ALL in memory only for PDB2.
choices.A: The data dictionary in PDB2 is updated.
choices.E: The STATISTICS_LEVEL parameter is set to ALL in memory for both PDBs.

questions.question_text:
One of your multitenant container databases (CDB) contains two pluggable databases (PDBs) called PDB1 and PDB2.
You connect to PDB2 as a common user with DBA privileges.
The STATISTICS_LEVEL parameter is PDB modifiable.
As the user SYS, you execute this command successfully on PDB2:
SQL> ALTER SET STATISTICS_LEVEL=ALL SID='*' SCOPE=BOTH;
Which two statements are true about the result of this command?

choices.F: SYSTEM is able to create views in any PDB as a result of being granted the C##ROLE1 role.
choices.D: The C##DBA_ADMIN user is a local user in CDB$ROOT.
choices.B: The C##DBA_ADMIN user is a local user in CDB$ROOT and PDB$SEED.
choices.A: The C##DBA_ADMIN user is able to create views in any PDB as a result of being granted the C##ROLE1 role.
choices.C: The c##role1 role will always have the same privileges in all current and future PDBs.
choices.E: SYSTEM is able to create views in any PDB as a result of being a DBA user.

discussion.content: C is not correct. A,E,F should be choice.

Answer C I think is not correct. Initially the role will be the same for all the PDBs. But you are allowed to grant locally to a common role.
Doc: https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/CNCPT/cdblogic.htm#CNCPT89364

choices.A: use the CREATE PLUGGABLE DATABASE command across a database link from CDB$ROOT to the non-CDB.
choices.E: Use only the DUPLICATE DATABASE command.
choices.B: Use Data Pump to export the non-CDB and import it into a newly created, empty PDB.
choices.D: Use the CREATE DATABASE command with an XML file created by executing DBMS_PDB in the non-CDB.

discussion.content:
Which two methods can be used to create a PDB from a non-CDB Oracle 12c Database? (Choose two.)
A. use the CREATE PLUGGABLE DATABASE command across a database link from CDB$ROOT to the non-CDB.
B. Use Data Pump to export the non-CDB and import it into a newly created, empty PDB.
C. Use only the DBMS_PDB package.
D. Use the CREATE DATABASE command with an XML file created by executing DBMS_PDB in the non-CDB.
E. Use only the DUPLICATE DATABASE command.
Unfortunately, the question is not clear

questions.question_text:
Your multitenant container database (CDB) CDB1, has no startup triggers and contains multiple pluggable databases (PDBs).
It was started up by using the command which executed successfully with no errors:

SQL> STARTUP MOUNT -
Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

comments.content: I take this back, recommended anser is right.. the CDB$SEED is open

discussion.content:
Status MOUNT:
e) instance is started => spfile has been read
b) database structure is known (e.g. for offline backup when db is in NOARCHIVELOG) => controlfile has been read
Nothing else is opened at this point

B E is my bet here.

Prior to 12.1.0.2, when the CDB is started, all PDBs remain in mounted mode. There is no default mechanism to automatically start them when the CDB is started. The way to achieve this is to use a system trigger on the CDB to start some or all of the PDBs.
